  "copyright": "Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License",
  "licences": [
    "Cantus Database",
    "Portuguese Early Music Database",
    "Slovak Early Music Database",
    "Hungarian Chant Database",
    "Fontes Cantus Bohemiae",
    "Cantus Planus in Polonia",
    "Cantus Ultimus",

    "Gregorien.info",
    "Antiphonale & Graduale Synopticum",
    "Medieval Music Manuscripts Online",
    "Codicologica et Hymnologica Bohemica Liturgica",
    "Fragmenta Manuscriptorum Musicalium Hungariae Mediaevalis",
    "Birgittine Database",
    "Medieval Music Manuscripts from Austrian Monasteries",
    "Usuarium - A Digital Library and Database",
    "BENEDICAMUS: Music and Poetic Creativity for a Unique Moment in the Western Christian Liturgy, c. 1000-1500",
    "Melodiarium Hungariae Medii Aevi Digitale"
  ],
  "terms and conditions": "Access to the database is free, in accordance with the aims of the International Musicological Society’s Study Group Cantus Planus, which include the exchange of data in electronic form. Following the Tri-Agency Statement on Equity, Diversity and Inclusion (EDI), the Cantus Database, while committed to excellence in research and research training, recognizes that achieving a more equitable, diverse and inclusive Canadian research enterprise is essential to creating the innovative and impactful research necessary to advance knowledge and understanding, and to respond to local, national and global challenges. The Cantus Database will work with those involved in the research system to develop the inclusive culture needed for research excellence and to achieve outcomes that are rigorous, relevant and accessible to diverse populations."
}
